block.p: Caryn Michele Herold, the daughter of Rochelle Herold and Dr. Frederick Herold of Hollywood, Fla., was married last evening to Wade Teman, a son of Arlene and Seymour Teman of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Robert P. Frazin performed the ceremony at the Turnberry Isle Resort and Club in Aventura, Fla.

Mrs. Teman, 28, is an associate producer for Dateline NBC, the news magazine program in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, an internist and nephrologist, is the president of the South Florida Primary Care Group in Hollywood. Her mother is the director for education at the Solel Nursery-Kindergarten School there.

Caryn Michele Herold, the daughter of Rochelle Herold and Dr. Frederick Herold of Hollywood, Fla., was married last evening to Wade Teman, a son of Arlene and Seymour Teman of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Robert P. Frazin performed the ceremony at the Turnberry Isle Resort and Club in Aventura, Fla.

Mrs. Teman, 28, is an associate producer for Dateline NBC, the news magazine program in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, an internist and nephrologist, is the president of the South Florida Primary Care Group in Hollywood. Her mother is the director for education at the Solel Nursery-Kindergarten School there.

Mr. Teman, 34, is the chief operating officer of Amore Capital Management, a hedge fund in Great Neck, N.Y. He graduated from George Washington University. His mother is the co-owner of Golden Touch, an accessories store in Syosset, N.Y. His father is an associate director at Bear, Stearns & Company, the New York investment bank.
